item.title: Director, Capital Markets Benchmarking Analytics and Strategy
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, Capital Markets Benchmarking Analytics and Strategy

Job Description

Primary Responsibilities

  • Lead as the core contact for internal global Capital Markets benchmarking operative, responsible for primary and secondary peer group reporting, analysis and analytics for key executive level stakeholders not limited to Group Executives, Capital Markets operating committee (inclusive of CEO and CFO) and trading desk heads
  • Apply sector-specific expertise and knowledge to analyze business-level competitive positioning using quantitative modelling and deep-dive research
  • Partner and facilitate rapport with front-office trading and banking teams to accumulate and apply competitive peer knowledge to develop action-oriented analysis and recommendations to drive executive discussion and decisions
  • Build upon infrastructure to lever large internal and external data sources (via analytics tools), not limited to market data applications such as Bloomberg, Capital IQ, Morningstar, as well as external insights from Dealogic; Coalition; Refinitive
  • Navigate and cut through complexity of CM peer strategy and micro-level transactions to dissect key findings and insights amongst subject matter not limited to balance sheet optimization; business model (revenue stream) analysis; investment bank compensation; and cost management.  Build upon comparable financial and non-financial KPIs (levering CM Platform team infrastructure) to evaluate peer vs. peer performance
  • Establish both traditional peer reporting model (external peer financial release, investor materials inclusive of investor day presentation, analyst and conferences calls) and output produced via ad hoc mosaic approaches integrated with internal CM business knowledge/expertise/research
  • Utilize and leverage business driver models and forecasting capabilities to drive insights for key business partners
  • Present output and findings to senior leadership (both verbally and through key materials), conveying on key recommendation and insights.  Answer direct front-office and executive inquiries as appropriate
  • Manage team of 3 to 5 professionals in a collaborative, fast pace environment

Must Haves:

  • Bachelor’s degree; with emphasis in finance/accounting or management preferred
  • +5 years of experience in a financial institution or management consulting firm with focus on banking/capital markets
  • Must be advanced with Power Point, Excel, Access, Outlook, Word, Bloomberg, Acrobat, etc.
  • Keen sense of numbers and strong analytical skills with ability to prioritize multiple tasks and handle time-sensitive executive level requests on a continuous basis
  • Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills with the ability to influence stakeholders and mobilize teams to deliver on common goals
  • Innovative, proactive, and persistent in issue resolution

Nice to Have:

  • CPA, CFA or Finance MBA with specialization in capital markets and/or financial institutions
  • Prior experience in equity research; investor relations (within financial institutions); Capital Markets business management; and/or Capital Markets peer benchmarking consulting
  • Existing knowledge/expertise in Capital Markets business and transactions (inclusive of bank structure, risk management concepts, financial markets, and instruments)
  • Working knowledge of Python, R, or other data analytics toolsets.

Job Summary

Key leader within the Capital Markets Platform Performance Management team with responsibility on developing strategic benchmarking output and innovative competitive analytics to advance business leaders initiatives, strategy and knowledge vis a vis external market landscape.

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

What will you do?

  • Design and develop innovative reporting solutions to monitor operational performance, present insights to underlying drivers, and support leaders in managing their business
  • Source data from various platforms and build automated data pipelines
  • Lead conversations with business partners to solicit requirements and project feedback

  • Expert technical documentation skills and the ability to effectively communicate, verbally and in writing, technical concepts to a non-technical audience
  • Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and working independently

item.title: Project Manager - Talent Data & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Project Manager - Talent Data & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

You will lead and manage several key transformational projects for the Talent Data & Analytics team. These projects all contribute to the digital transformation of HR as part of the Reimagine HR program. Projects can include setting up data management and sustainment teams, driving infrastructure upgrades, managing RFPs/RFIs, supervising new product builds etc. Your experience as a project manager/scrum master driving data and analytics projects has prepared you for the challenge of standing up new teams and processes, dealing with several stakeholders across the bank and responding dynamically to changing requirements.

What will you do? 

  • Effectively manage the planning, organization and implementation of all major transformational projects in Talent Data & Analytics.
  • Develop and manage detailed development sprints, identify early warning indicators, provide direction for early resolution of risks, issues and clear escalation path for program committees.
  • Oversee staffing levels to efficiently meet project delivery requirements and tracks value for effective decision-making.
  • Collaborate with internal and external partners (e.g. Vendors, RBC IT teams, Product)
  • Build and present updates to project sponsors and executive steering committees
  • Oversee the development of program/project plans, KPIs and metrics (including status reporting), prioritization calls & project communications.
  • Ensure the completion of risk assessments and the identification & execution of contingency plans.
  • Deliver initiatives using appropriate methods, including Agile and Iterative Waterfall.
  • Satisfy multiple stakeholders in a complex business and technology environment

What do you need to succeed?

  • 5+ years Project Management/Scrum experience; spanning medium to large data and analytics programs
  • A proven track record of successfully delivering complex projects with a wide range of stakeholders and skillsets
  • Verbal and written communication skills with excellent attention to detail, and passion for innovation
  • Proven ability to manage highly visible programs/projects with third party vendors
  • Advanced knowledge of change, issue, and risk management and working knowledge of Software development lifecycle (SDLC) and Agile delivery methodologies/day-2-day ceremonies; Agile experience fostering team improvements through standard Agile processes and ceremonies.
  • Undergraduate degree (preferred)

Nice-to-have 

  • Project/Program Management/Scrum certifications
  • Experience delivering Data & Analytics projects in Human Resources a plus
  • Hands-on experience with Workday HRIS a plus

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater scopes of work

item.title: Customer Insights, Data & Analytics Product Manager (Ownr)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Customer Insights, Data & Analytics Product Manager (Ownr)

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of business – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives – to move RBC ‘beyond banking’. We’re building a world-class organization focused on designing exceptional experiences, exploring new business models and creating exponential value. In 2020, we were named by Fast Company as one of the 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators and we’re looking for team members with the curiosity to explore, the capabilities to build and capacity to help us deliver our mission

What is the opportunity?

Ownr is seeking a talented, experienced and passionate Product Manager focused on customer insights, Data & Analytics to join our growing team. In this role you will work across the business to support and manage the execution of data-related products and projects to help drive our customer understanding and cross-functional capabilities. We are looking for vocal futurists who have a passion for technology and are inspired by the idea of bringing to life product roadmaps that benefit hundreds of thousands of people at a key milestone in their lives.

About Ownr

At Ownr, we have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. We\'re on a mission to become the leading platform for entrepreneurship in Canada, and it takes an entire team to build something big. So join our team and discover how we can help entrepreneurs make their dreams a reality.

 

What you will do

  • Help set the product vision and strategy for data, analytics, and customer insights
  • Own the translation of business requirements, you will execute to deliver solutions that expand our data and analytics capabilities across multiple portfolios.
  • Design and conduct analyses using various techniques (developing frameworks, building dashboards, segmentation, modelling) to provide value for the stakeholders you support.
  • Responsible for creating and managing quality data products, processes and services to ensure growth and achievement of our business goals.
  • Understand our key drivers, customer use cases, and full user flow impact across all platforms.
  • Create, manage, and maintain KPI\'s to monitor, analyze and improve conversion
  • Lead the product planning and development process through backlog grooming, refinement, and prioritization activities
  • Define and detail User Stories and prioritize team backlogs in accordance to our business drivers.
  • Evaluate and document the requirements for each product feature, articulate these requirements, answer questions and make scope trade-off decisions as needed.
  • Ensure optimal delivery by removing barriers and obstacles that impact performance and develop contingency plans to demonstrate adaptability while supporting continuous learning.
  • Bridge technical, business and creative worlds, engaging with matrixed teams including development, UX/UI design, copy, legal, risk and compliance, creating a collaborative environment while maximizing on business return.
  • Drive internal stakeholders and cross-functional business unit engagements necessary for an optimal on-time launch.
  • Focus on backend functionality as well as user-facing features that make world-class user engaging platforms.

 

Skills you\'ll need to succeed

 Must have

  • Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in an analytical function (e.g. Business Analytics, Consulting).
  • Experience working as a Product Manager in a SaaS environment.
  • Proven work experience in data product management (growth-stage company experience a plus) and working with agile teams and organizations.
  • Experience translating business requirements to actionable software solutions.
  • In-depth knowledge of agile processes and principles, with the ability to provide direction to the agile team and stakeholders throughout.
  • Extensive experience developing use cases, epics and stories in a clear and concise manner, enabling the engineering team to deliver maximum productivity and value
  • Experience maintaining and prioritizing the backlog in accordance to business and technology drivers.
  • Experience in the planning of product releases and setting expectations for delivery of new functionality.
  • A Proven ability to make hard decisions in a fast-paced environment, while actively identifying and mitigating issues that have an impact on successful completion of goals.

item.title: Manager, Business Intelligence & Information Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Business Intelligence & Information Management

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC Regional Banking Support’s BFS Reporting is hiring a Manager, Business Intelligence & Information Management role that will support strategic reporting and visual insights for Regional Banking’s BFS by successfully transforming data into useful, relevant information, and by leveraging sound business knowledge, additional sources of information, and resources to deliver insight to the BFS field.  The position plays a role in driving strategic, timely, and accurate insights to business partners and senior leaders in a BFS banking environment, alongside key technology partners. 

What will you do?

  • Utilize cutting edge business intelligence capabilities to optimize business results, define, measure, and deliver insights and mitigate risk.

  • Design and develop/enhance innovative reporting solutions to monitor performance management, present key analytical and business insights to underlying drivers in support of the BFS advisors and leaders on client and coaching insights to drive an exceptional client experience.

  • Take end to end responsibility in the development and enhancement of performance metrics and reporting in Tableau.

  • Respond to ad-hoc investigations, inquiries, data, and report requests as assigned.

  • Run production jobs as assigned.

  • Demonstrate Subject Matter Expertise in data and reporting infrastructure design, configuration and optimization, providing recommendations on approach and execution.

  • Apply standard design principles and data visualization techniques to measure key indicators, disclose trends, provide proactive actionable insights/indicators and address business questions.

  • Identify appropriate data sources and perform Extract/Transform/Load (ETL) for data modelling, data quality assessments, understand patterns and provide the basis to inform the reporting solution which provides meaningful performance management insights.

  • Participate in conversations with internal partners to understand their business strategies (role design, incentive, practice management and portfolio quality) and objectives in order to define/recommend reporting solutions to meet those objectives, effectively communicate project status and develop relationships to ensure satisfaction.

  • Participate in design and solution review demonstrations with the Senior Manager and/or internal partners at critical tollgates to ensure adherence to requirements, resolve obstacles, while mitigating deployment risk and the need for post-deployment modifications.

  • Test and validate (QA) new and existing reports and analytics for adherence to business and technical requirements.

  • Enhance and optimize existing production processes.  

  • Create and maintain accurate documentation related to reporting solutions, including specifications, data lineage, technical and business definitions for metrics, and test plan/test cases.

  • Be a thought partner within the BFS Reporting team, supporting the developments of insights, processes, data approaches/ methodologies and information that is valued by partners across Regional Banking and BFS.

  • Learn on a consistent basis, be adaptable to change due to re-prioritizing of items.

       

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Engineering, related field or equivalent related experience.

  • Demonstrated ETL and big data modeling capabilities, with programming experience in large databases/datasets and using SAS, SQL Server and Teradata SQL Assistant.

  • Experience in statistical methods, strong data profiling, cleaning, and mining.

  • Proficient in SQL extracts in order to investigate data from data warehouse and other sources (flat files) for investigation/analysis purposes.

  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to senior leaders in order to inform of strategic decisions.

  • Proven quantitative analytical (including data knowledge, data discovery, data aggregation and summarization) and problem solving skills.

  • UNIX knowledge (i.e. submit process, create logs, store data).

  • Advanced in developing reports using Tableau.

  • Data knowledge on RBC’s EDW.

  • Be skilled in Microsoft applications (Excel, PowerPoint).

  • Expert technical documentation skills and the ability to effectively communicate, verbally and in writing, technical concepts to a non-technical audience.

Nice-to-have

  • Financial Services Industry/Business Financial Services knowledge

  • Experience in developing performance metrics/reports

  • Programming/coding skills in Python and Hadoop (HIVE) and Datameer

  • Experience with Tableau Security, Tableau Server Administration

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work and take on progressively greater accountabilities

item.title: Lead Python Developer - Data Protection and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Lead Python Developer - Data Protection and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The data protection team is at the forefront of delivering actionable insider threat and analytics services. Using data science practices tied to web and analytics services it helps highlight actionable events for ongoing investigations.

As the lead developer, you will be accountable for extending and enhancing current application services while working closely with product owners to develop and link together various components with a focus on overall fidelity of data models, optimization, product design and delivering enhancements as part of current managed web analytics services. This opportunity is suitable for someone who is skilled in web application development, motivated, someone who enjoy working on a variety of problems and enhancements, someone who works well in a multi-disciplinary team as well as working independently on key tasks.

If you want to innovate and be part of a big picture strategic delivery with a direct impact on organization change this is the placement for you!

What will you do?

  • Delivering new design and development specifications based on customer requirements, while adhering to standard procedures and techniques.
  • Creating test transactions and running tests to find errors and revise application programs.
  • Participating in post-implementation reviews of application development content and processes; continually working to create a learning environment by sharing about the participation process with others.
  • Supporting the implementation of application programs; fixing any existing or new bugs.
  • Design, Develop and enhance current web services
  • Help design, implementing and optimized UI functions
  • Collaborate within the team and stakeholders to enhance and expand current solutions

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • BS/MS in Computer Science or related area or equivalent experience
  • 3-5 years of professional full stack development
  • 3+ years with experience of working with Python/Java/HTML/CSS/SQL
  • Ability to understand software requirements based on program specification
  • Demonstrated experience with building web application frameworks like flask
  • Strong knowledge of web design, testing phases and working with data science
  • Understanding of software development lifecycle and experience with API
  • Experience of development in Cloud environment
  • Excellent analytical skills and problem solving attitude
  • Experience with relational databases(MSSQL, MySQL)

Nice to have

  • Experience with machine learning and statistical techniques, testing/validation, visualizing data, test results and assess model performance
  • Experience with analytics, anomaly detection, model refinement and efficacy
  • Experience with big data technologies – Hadoop, NoSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques, and graph technologies
  • Experience in building backend system with Python, Flask
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines
  • Knowledge of DevOps and strong debugging skills
  • Experience with Git and process automation
  • Experience in UI/UX Design

What’s in it for you?
 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.   • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

item.title: Senior Manager, Credit Cards Finance Performance Management, Insights & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Credit Cards Finance Performance Management, Insights & Analytics

Job Description

  • Partner with the Credit Cards business by delivering insights and analysis and support for business case development
  • Collaborate with credit cards business and finance colleagues to continually improve forecasting methodologies
  • Develop standardized credit cards business case models to ensure consistency of financial analysis leveraging best practices and existing product profitability and campaign profitability data sets
  • Partner with Canadian Banking Finance colleagues to implement capability and analytics road map, seek continuous feedback for ongoing enhancement
  • Contribute to enhancing finance effectiveness through forecast/planning model improvement, standardization of data insights and reporting

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Strong technical skills and experience with data analytics and financial modelling
  • Comfortable dealing with large and complex data sets
  • Extensive knowledge and understanding of credit cards, loyalty, FI products and services, sales, pricing and risk management
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills and presentation skills; effective communicator and ability to influence and defend recommendations
  • MBA, MMA or professional accounting or finance designation such as CPA or CFA

Nice-to-have 

  • Understanding of finance theory / application; understanding of financial / statistical concepts and approaches
  • Experience with data visualization tools i.e.) Tableau, ThoughtSpot etc.
  • Growth Mindset 
  • Intellectual Curiosity

Job Summary

As Senior Manager, Credit Cards Finance Performance Management, Insights & Analytics, you will collaborate with Finance & Credit Cards business colleagues to drive profitable growth through insightful business and financial analysis. With strong financial modelling skills, solid statistical understanding and exceptional business acumen, you will develop business cases and perform ad hoc analyses to guide business decisions.
